Function Documentation

void RadioDriver_Initialize ( bidirectional_block_handler  frameReceived  ) 

Initialize the transceiver and sets the frame receive call back function.

void RadioDriver_SetRxStartHandler ( notification_handler  handler  ) 
void RadioDriver_SetTxPower ( uint8_t  power  ) 

Set the transmit power of the transceiver. Use on of the RADIODRIVER_TX_POWER_X_DBM constants.

void RadioDriver_SetChannel ( uint8_t  channel  ) 

Set the transceiver channel. Use either RADIODRIVER_CHANNEL_X, RADIODRIVER_FREQUENCY_X_MHZ or just an integer between 11 and 26 (both included).

int8_t RadioDriver_GetRssi (  ) 

Same as GetRawRssi but here the value is converted to dBm.

void RadioDriver_Send ( void *  data,
uint8_t  length 
)

Send a frame. The transceiver transmission buffer can hold a maximum of 128 bytes including the length specifier and the 16 bit FCS if automatic CRC generation and check is used. This leaves a maximum of either 127 or 125 bytes for user data.
